intro: Globularia fuxeensis, commonly known as the Fuxé globularia, is a flowering plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It is characterized by its compact, globular growth habit and is typically found in rocky or coastal environments. The plant produces small, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink, often blooming in late spring to early summer. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is known for its aromatic foliage. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
